articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Minister of Development of Far East of Russia
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Minister of Development of Far East of Russia
						
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong met and had a talk with Minister of Development of Far East of Russia Alexandr Galushka and his party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
					 Alexandr Galushka doubles as chairman of the Russian side to the Inter-Governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology between the DPRK and Russia.

articles.title: Minister of Development of Far East of Russia Arrives Here
articles.content:
Minister of Development of Far East of Russia Arrives Here
						
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Minister of Development of Far East of Russia Alexandr Galushka, who is chairman of the Russian side to the Inter-Governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade,    Economy, Science and Technology between the DPRK and Russia, and his party arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Homage Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Homage Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- The minister of Development of Far East of Russia and his party Monday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill.
					 They laid flowers before the statues in humblest reverence and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Nepali Friendship Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Nepali Friendship Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- The friendship delegation of Baktapur City of Nepal headed by Ram Mani Bhattarai, administrator of the city, left here for home on Monday.

articles.title: Many Scientific Achievements Achieved by Universities
articles.content:
Many Scientific Achievements Achieved by Universities 
						
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Scientific achievements have been made by teachers and researchers of different universities in the DPRK.
					 The Global Environment Science Faculty of Kim Il Sung University solved technical problems to put the climate forecast on a more scientific basis.
					
					 Researchers under the Life Science Faculty of the university bred a plant high in salt-resistance, which is considered to be favorable for reclaiming tidelands. And their success in the research of sexing wild birds is conducive to increasing the number of wild birds in the Central Zoo.
					
					 Kim Chaek University of Technology developed application programs for new OS, thus making contributions to updating production processes in different units.
					
					 Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry has paved a way for making bonding agent, indispensable to the production of magnesia clinker, with locally available raw materials.
					
					 University of Sciences has made a big stride in research of protein synthesis.
					
					 Scientific achievements have been made at other universities throughout the country including Sariwon University of Geology.

articles.title: DPRK Scholar on DPRK-U.S. Nuclear Faceoff
articles.content:
DPRK Scholar on DPRK-U.S. Nuclear Faceoff
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Twenty years has passed since the adoption of the DPRK-U.S. Agreed Framework on October 21, Juche 83 (1994).
					 In this regard, Dr. Kang Chol of Kim Il Sung University in the DPRK told KCNA that the U.S. should reflect what it has got in the 20-year-long nuclear faceoff with the DPRK.
					
					 He further said:
					
					 According to a recent report by south Korea's Yonhap News, Robert Gallucci, former senior official of the U.S. Department of State, repeatedly called for unconditioned dialogue to settle the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula, claiming that it is impossible to destroy the DPRK's nukes.
					
					 Gallucci, who was active as a U.S. representative at the time of the adoption of the Agreed Framework, stated in a paper presented to an international seminar in Seoul on Oct. 10. that the policy, pursued by the U.S. and south Korea to "defuse" the "nuclear threat" from the DPRK for the past 20 years, came to failure. And he added it could not be a strategy to seek a solution to the issue through sanctions or regime "collapse".
					
					 The present U.S. administration should come to its senses, in the light of such opinions raised by politicians, scholars and other people of different strata at home.
					
					 Not a few countries in the world have possessed nukes superior in quantity than the DPRK. But the U.S. has long put sanctions on the DPRK only, because of its inveterate repugnancy and hostility toward the DPRK.

articles.title: Four Loyal Commanders in Imjin Patriotic War
articles.content:
Four Loyal Commanders in Imjin Patriotic War
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Among patriotic commanders emerged during the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598) were four commanders who distinguished themselves in the war by organizing volunteers' corps to beat back the Japanese invaders.
					 They were Kwak Jae U, Ko Kyong Myong, Kim Chon Il and Jo Hon.
					
					 The volunteers' corps led by Kwak Jae U, called "Red-gowned General", had performed great military services in shielding the 80,000 Blocks of Complete Collection of Buddhist Scriptures, one of the nation's treasures kept at Haein Temple.
					
					 Another corps led by Jo Hon sacrificially recaptured Chongju Castle from the invaders, and another corps led by Ko Kyong Myong in his sixties fought life-or-death battles against the invaders to strike them with terror in Kumsan area. The volunteers' corps led by Kim Chon Il dealt heavy blows to the invaders in the coastal area of Kyonggi Province.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Training All People as Scientific and Technological Talents
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Training All People as Scientific and Technological Talents
						
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday in an editorial says that it is the theory and consistent policy of the Workers' Party of Korea to attach importance to science and technology and talents. 
					 All people should be trained as scientific and technological talents. This slogan is something which any country dares put up, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 Educating all the people to be scientific and technological talents means training all people as talents possessed of rich scientific and technological knowledge and creative ability. In other words, it means educating all members of the society to be revolutionary talents well versed in the latest scientific and technological knowledge and capable of successfully applying it into practice to satisfactorily solve scientific and technological issues arising in the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 The long history of our revolution is shining as the history of the drive for remolding human beings and training revolutionaries. President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il said long ago: "The popular masses are the great teacher of the revolution" and "if there is an almighty being in the world, it is none other than the popular masses".
					
					 These words reflect the revolutionary philosophy that it is necessary to put forward the popular masses as masters and creators of everything and it is necessary to exert primary efforts for preparing them as reliable workers for the revolution and construction.
					
					 The most profound love for the people lies in firmly equipping all members of the society with independent thought and consciousness and training them as talents with high creative ability.
					
					 The editorial calls upon all Koreans to dynamically speed up the process for training all people as scientific and technological talents and fully demonstrate the spirit of creating the Korean speed on all fronts for building a thriving nation under the leadership of the great party.

articles.title: Hurdles in Way of Improving Inter-Korean Relations Should Be Removed, to Begin with: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Hurdles in Way of Improving Inter-Korean Relations Should Be Removed, to Begin with: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) --  It is improper behavior in any sense for the south Korean authorities to let human scum scatter anti-DPRK leaflets to chill the atmosphere of improving the north-south relations, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is a challenge and mockery of the aspiration and wishes of the fellow countrymen to slander the other side while talking about improved relations. It is also an act of treachery as it goes against the trend of the times.
					
					 Mud-slinging at the other party is nothing helpful to improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 It is painful that Koreans live separated due to foreign forces. If Koreans slander and antagonize each other, who will benefit from those practices. They would only help those forces displeased with the reconciliation and unity of the Korean nation and the improvement of the inter-Korean relations fish in troubled waters.
					
					 Any smear campaign against the other side is the root cause of chilling the atmosphere of having dialogue and mending the relations.
					
					 Confidence between the north and the south should be shown in practice, not with words.
					
					 Those directly responsible for improving the north-south relations should be prudent in talking and deed and lead media persons to create the atmosphere of improving the relations.
					
					 Whether to put an end to acts hostile to the dialogue partner including mud-slinging at present or persist in such acts under absurd pretexts is a touchstone distinguishing the stand and attitude of improving the north-south relations.
					
					 Explicitly speaking once again, if the north and the south are to have dialogue and improve relations, it is necessary to remove hurdles lying in the way of doing so, first of all.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts U.S. Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts U.S. Human Rights Abuses
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- A series of drone attacks by the U.S. forces in Pakistan under the pretext of a "war on terror" left eight innocent people dead and six others wounded on October 6 alone.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary says it has become clearer that the "war on terror" which the U.S. claims is aimed to protect people from the threat of terrorism is human rights abuses and a genocide.
					
					 Infringement upon sovereignty by military attacks and killing of innocent civilians are the worst human rights abuses, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					 It is self-evident that the "war on terror" whereby the U.S. is inflicting unspeakable misfortune and sufferings on other countries and nations in different parts of the world is unprecedented state-sponsored terrorism and hideous human rights abuses.
					
					 The U.S. is the most brutal man-killer and the world's worst human rights abuser. It should be brought to justice for perpetrating all sorts of human rights abuses in different parts of the world.
					
					 The human rights abuses committed by the U.S. under the pretext of "war on terror" make the international community to look back on the truth of the past history. It proves that the infringement upon sovereignty leads to merciless abuse of human rights.
					
					 Human rights precisely mean state sovereignty. No human rights can be guaranteed without state sovereignty.
					
					 The state sovereignty is guaranteed with the powerful muscle for self-defence, not with words. It is the only way of guaranteeing genuine human rights to counter any infringement with powerful force.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Authorities
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Authorities 
						
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Yun Pyong Se, puppet minister of Foreign Affairs of south Korea, at a recent international seminar talked rubbish that the north should swim with the international community's  "trend of peace, development and human rights" and get rid of isolation which was invited by itself. Hwang Jun Guk, chief delegate to the six-party talks, in a keynote speech at a symposium let loose invectives that "the north's nuclear adventure" reduced its inhabitants to "hostages of nuclear weapons." He went the lengths of finding fault with the north's line of simultaneously developing the two fronts and impudently admonishing it to "guarantee human rights and develop economy simultaneously".
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Monday terms this a cock-and-bull story told by those bereft of normal judging power being obsessed with the policy of toeing outsiders and escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 The diplomatic authorities of south Korea make no scruple of letting loose outbursts provoking and slandering the dialogue partner, quite contrary to the requirements of the fellow countrymen and the trend of the times, an act of inciting confrontation while deliberately disturbing the north-south relations.
					
					 Traitors Yun Pyong Se and Hwang Jun Guk pulled up the DPRK by letting loose sheer sophism only to disclose their dirty colors as stooges of the U.S. in its racket for stifling the DPRK and its colonial servants. The atmosphere for improving the north-south relations is chilled due to such fools unaware of what is the dignity of the nation and what is shame.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to find their obligation in the desire of the fellow countrymen and the requirements of the times and cool their head overheated with confrontation.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Denounces U.S. Nuclear Threat against DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Denounces U.S. Nuclear Threat against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- It was recently disclosed that the U.S. agreed with the south Korean authorities to use nuclear weapons in case of "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula.
					 According to the memoir published by former U.S. Secretary of Defense Panetta on Oct. 7, he informed the south Korean puppet forces of the U.S. stand to use nukes in case of "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula in 2011. He opened to public that in 2010 when he was holding the post of director of CIA, he received a report from the then commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea that a war scenario against the DPRK "included the program for using nukes."
					
					 This is another evidence of the U.S. grave nuclear threat to the DPRK.
					
					 The disclosed data prove the U.S. policy of nuclear blackmail against the DPRK which has lasted for decades and the gravity of its evermore escalating moves for a nuclear war against the latter.
					
					 The U.S. has posed a nuclear threat to the DPRK according to its policy of nuclear blackmail against the latter since the 1950s.
					
					 There are a lot of scenarios for nuclear attack which have been disclosed during the period, including the 1953 OPLAN 8-53 and recent OPLAN 8022-02.
					
					 The U.S. brigandish nuclear threat to the DPRK has been put into practice.
					
					 The disclosure of the U.S. above-said scenario brought into bolder relief its ulterior intention to drive the political and military confrontation on the Korean Peninsula into the worst phase in history, bind the south Korean puppet forces to the military alliance system for aggression more tightly and deploy THAAD in south Korea with ease.
					
					 The U.S. is set to use the peninsula as a nuclear forward base and a bridgehead for carrying out its Asia-Pacific strategy.
					
					 The reality proves that the U.S. nuclear blackmail aimed at aggression and domination has entered a phase of practical strike, going beyond the level of threat.
					
					 The validity of the DPRK's line of simultaneously bolstering up nukes and pushing forward economic construction is being proved with each passing day. 
					
					 All service personnel and people of the DPRK have keenly realized once again how wise it was when it decided to bolster up nuclear deterrence to cope with the U.S. nuclear threat.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear weapons serve as treasured sword of justice protecting the nation from the U.S. nuclear blackmail and aggression and a reliable shield defending the peace on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will further bolster up its nuclear deterrence for self-defence both in quality and quantity till they completely foil the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and nuclear threat to it.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Declare Their Action for Release of All Prisoners of Conscience
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Declare Their Action for Release of All Prisoners of Conscience 
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- The Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in south Korea together with members of at least 50 organizations including the People's Solidarity for the Repeal of the "Security Law" held a Thursday rally in Seoul on Oct. 16 for the abolition of the fascist law and the release of prisoners of conscience.
					 At the rally speakers said the Thursday rally has become a means for demanding justice, peace, human rights and independent reunification for decades since it started protest against the "civilian government" which ignored the release of prisoners of conscience.
					
					 The rally which started for the release of husbands and children thrown behind bars developed into actions for the release of all prisoners of conscience and they were escalated into a movement for abolishing the "Security Law" which produced prisoners of conscience on the basis of the awareness that law and system of society should be changed into just ones, they noted.
					
					 They declared that they would carry on their actions till the "Security Law" is abolished and all prisoners of conscience are set free.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Calls for Release of Prisoners of Conscience
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Calls for Release of Prisoners of Conscience
						
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore on Oct. 16 carried an editorial calling for the release of prisoners of conscience and democracy.
					 The editorial said that there took place the 1 000th Thursday rally of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy.
					
					 The members of the organization have waged actions for a true world free from human rights abuses for decades since they started an action in protest against the "civilian government" which refused to set free prisoners of conscience, the editorial noted.
					
					 It said that the members have called for realizing democracy of society despite all sorts of suppression and arrest by the security authorities.
					
					 The actions of the organization are drawing great attention under the present regime reminiscent of the past military dictatorship, it said, adding the more dynamic action of the organization will be staged in protest against the ceaseless human rights abuses by the power.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Sweden
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Sweden
						
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" was brought out in booklet by the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association and the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					 The work published on August 25, Juche 102 (2013) deals with the Songun revolutionary exploits of leader Kim Jong Il, essence and originality of his Songun revolutionary idea and tasks for successfully accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Songun.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony was held at a publishing house in Stockholm, Sweden on Oct. 8.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Thailand
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Thailand
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- The Thai committee for remembering HE Kim Jong Il was inaugurated at Rajabat Pranakorn University on Oct. 13 on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of his demise.
					 Songchit Pullarp, chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize various political and cultural events on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Britain
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Britain
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- A seminar on leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science" took place in London on Oct. 11.
					 The work, published on November 1, Juche 83 (1994), clarifies the idea that Korean-style socialism based on the Juche-oriented socialist theory is the most scientific and viable socialism and the principled issues arising in defending socialism.
					
					 Present at the seminar were personages of the New Communist Party of Britain, British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK.
					
					 Present there on invitation were a staff member of the DPRK embassy in London.
					
					 Participants of the seminar heard the explanation of the main contents of the work and speeches.
					
					 The chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy said that the validity of Kim Jong Il's work has been clearly proved by the reality of the DPRK which is dynamically advancing along the road of socialism despite the moves of the U.S. and imperialist allied forces to stifle it.
					
					 The secretary general of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea noted that it is essential for accomplishing the socialist cause to fully demonstrate the superiority of socialism to capitalism.
					
					 A member of the Korean Friendship Association UK stressed that the British authorities and media are pulling up the DPRK over its "human rights" but it is, in fact, the Western world where most elementary rights of human beings are not properly guaranteed, calling on the friends of socialist Korea in Britain to protect it  from this malignant false propaganda.
					
					 A message to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Observe WPK's Birthday
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Observe WPK's Birthday
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 69th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The Thai paper Xing San Daily on Oct. 8 dedicated one whole page to an article titled "Ever-victorious WPK" illustrated with a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The Syrian paper Al Nour on Oct. 2 carried an article titled "On the occasion of 69th founding anniversary of WPK" which introduced the history of the WPK which has won one victory after another amid absolute support and trust of the popular masses.
					
					 The Indian paper New Delhi Times on Oct. 4 carried an article titled "Historical roots of WPK" which said:
					
					 The formation of Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU) was an event of special significance in shaping the destiny of the Korean people and the modern history of Korea.The WPK took its roots in DIU.
					
					 The programme of DIU became the basis of the WPK's programme.
					
					 The principle of independence, idea of DIU, serves as the guidelines for building of the WPK and its activities.
					
					 The WPK is successfully carrying forward the banner of single-minded unity held aloft by DIU.

articles.title: WPK's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
WPK's Birthday Celebrated Abroad 
 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Mexico, Bulgaria and Nepal in the period from Oct. 7 and 9 to celebrate the 69th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 Hung on the front walls of the venues of the meetings were portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 On display at their venues were photos documenting the party- building leadership exploits and Songun leadership exploits of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, photos showing the true picture of the WPK and books and photos introducing the efforts of the army and people of the DPRK to build a thriving nation. 
					
					 Present at the meetings were people from all walks of life in those countries. Officials of the DPRK missions in those countries were present on invitation. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico praised Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for their party-building leadership exploits, adding that their idea of party building and feats are being successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association said the WPK headed by Kim Jong Un is the staff of the revolution leading the socialist cause and the mother party responsible for the destiny of the popular masses and serves as a valuable example to be followed by the world progressives. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) and other speakers referred to the fact that the peerless great men performed great exploits for founding and developing the WPK and that Kim Jong Un is wisely leading the WPK and the Korean people in their efforts for the reunification of the country and the building of a thriving nation. 
					
					 Messages of greeting to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Bulgaria and Nepal.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong se reune con ministro de Desarrollo del Lejano Oriente de Rusia
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong se reune con ministro de Desarrollo del Lejano Oriente de Rusia
						
Pyongyang, 20 de octubre (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, departio el dia 20 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el ministro de Desarrollo del Lejano Oriente de Rusia, Alexandr Galushka, presidente de la parte rusa del Comite Intergubernamental de Cooperacion de Comercio, Economia, Ciencia y Tecnica Corea-Rusia y su comitiva.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia regalos a cientificos de AEC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia regalos a cientificos de AEC 
						
Pyongyang, 20 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un ofrecio a los cientificos de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias (AEC) las viviendas del reparto de viviendas de cientificos Wisong y envio televisores, mantas acolchadas y utensilios a las familias que van a mudarse.
					Tuvo lugar el dia 19 en la AEC la ceremonia de entrega de los regalos.
					
					A la ocasion asistieron el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, funcionarios, cientificos, tecnicos y profesores de la AEC.

articles.title: Iniciada mudanza a nuevas viviendas de los cientificos de Academia Estatal de Ciencias
articles.content:
Iniciada mudanza a nuevas viviendas de los cientificos de Academia Estatal de Ciencias 
						
Pyongyang, 20 de octubre (ACNC) -- En virtud de las medidas benevolas tomadas por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, comenzo el dia 19 la mudanza a nuevas viviendas de los cientificos de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias. 
					Los camiones de mudanza llegaron en filas al reparto de modernas viviendas para los cientificos. 
					
					Viendo las viviendas y edificios publicos azulejados en diferentes colores, los cientificos y sus familiares expresaron profundo agradecimiento al Mariscal. 
					
					Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Choe Ryong Hae y otros cuadros directivos del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea visitaron las viviendas y felicitaron a sus nuevos propietarios compartiendo la alegria y entregandoles los articulos de recuerdo. 
					
					Se quedaron maravillados de las habitaciones, cocinas y otras partes de las casas amuebladas con fineza. 
					
					Los visitantes contaron a los duenos de nuevas casas sobre los inmensos esfuerzos del Mariscal por hacer felices a los cientificos y sobre la idea y politica del Partido de dar importancia a la ciencia y al personal talentoso. 
					
					Los cientificos y sus familiares festejaron la mudanza bailando al son de las musicas divertidas que repercutian en todo el reparto de viviendas.

articles.title: Alcanzan exitos cientificos profesores e investigadores de universidades coreanas
articles.content:
Alcanzan exitos cientificos profesores e investigadores de universidades coreanas
Pyongyang, 20 de octubre (ACNC) -- Los profesores y los investigadores de las universidades de distintas localidades del pais alcanzan valiosos exitos en sus investigaciones que realizan en los talleres de produccion.
					Los eruditos de la Facultad del Medio Ambiente Global de la Universidad Kim Il Sung establecieron la base de datos estandar a ser utilizada en el pronostico del clima y solucionaron varios problemas tecnicos abriendo asi las perspectivas de desarrollo cientifico de la rama.
					
					Los profesores de la Facultad de Ciencias de Vida del mismo plantel docente profundizaron la investigacion para proteger el dique de marisma y solucionar el problema de combustible y pienso de ganados y lograron asi reproducir las plantas con alta resistencia a la salinidad.
					
					Contribuyeron tambien a la reproduccion de animales del Parque Zoologico Nacional.
					
					Los intelectuales de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek inventaron los programas necesarios al nuevo sistema de operacion de la computacion e hicieron gran aporte a la modernizacion de las cadenas de produccion de varias unidades.
					
					Tambien sentaron la base cientifica y tecnica para producir la cuchilla del patin de velocidad.
					
					Los sabios de la Universidad de Industria Ligera Han Tok Su de Pyongyang abrieron las posibilidades de producir con materias primas el aglutinante necesario a la produccion de clinker de magnesia.
					
					Por otra parte, los educadores de la Universidad de Ciencias Naturales lograron notable alcance en el desarrollo de nuevo ingrediente medicinal y la sintesis de proteinas.
					
					Otras universidades, inclusive la Universidad de Geologia de Sariwon, contribuyen con sus exitos cientifico-tecnicos al desarrollo de economia nacional y a la mejora de los niveles de la vida del pueblo.
